title: Ticket #1363: condor_status -collector broken: "Error: communication error"
description:
On the CS pool, "condor_status -collector" returns "Error: communication error". This has also been observed on CHTC.

Tracing in GDB, it's failing in CondorQuery::fetchAds, condor_query.cpp:531: 

528		more = 1;
529		while (more)
530		{
531			if (!sock->code (more)) {
532				sock->end_of_message();
533				delete sock;
534				return Q_COMMUNICATION_ERROR;
535			}

The call to sock->code is failing. condor_status tries to contact all three collectors without luck.

Related task: There doesn't appear to be a condor_status -collector test. Ensure there is a test for all possible condor_status -subsystems, as well as -all. If this doesn't get checked before this ticket is resolved, add a new ticket.

Probably related: Ticket #1319: Bad -constraint to condor_status returns unhelpful error

2013-May-31 17:02:28 by tannenba:
This is a security issue.

What we want is if the machine is the CONDOR_DEVELOPER_COLLECTOR, then it should only return collector ads if the client is authorized as ADMINISTRATOR, else it should return collector ads at READ authentication level. And this behavior should be consistent, regardless of if the command is a QUERY_ANY or a QUERY_COLLECTOR_ADS.

2013-Oct-21 16:59:18 by jfrey:
Code Review

One small concern: The expression rewriting and log messages are triggered for any query of something other than collector ads (if the knob is enabled). We could limit the check to queries of all ad types.

Since this will only happen on our CS collector and the logging level is D_FULLDEBUG, it's a minor issue.
